Async - Class in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
Utility class to manage calls to FunctionalInterface by an Executor with support for timeouts(See: TimeLimit).
This class offers FunctionalInterfaces for Void and NonVoid functions up to 4 arguments.

You have access to a variety of methods named with the following principles:
starts with run for void returning methods and call for non void methods. ends with Before when the execution is time constrained and Later otherwise. When the execution time is constrained in case of a timeout the CompletableFuture will be completed exceptionally by a TimeLimitExceededException

Examples:
Async.Function1<R,T0> - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A Function that supports Exception
Async.Function2<R,T0,T1> - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A Function that supports Exception and 2 args
Async.Function3<R,T0,T1,T2> - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A Function that supports Exception and 3 args
Async.Function4<R,T0,T1,T2,T3> - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A Function that supports Exception and 4 args
Async.ThrowingRunnable - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A Runnable that supports Exception
Async.VoidFunction1<T0> - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A void returning Function that supports Exception
Async.VoidFunction2<T0,T1> - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A void returning Function that supports Exception and 2 args
Async.VoidFunction3<T0,T1,T2> - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A void returning Function that supports Exception and 3 args
Async.VoidFunction4<T0,T1,T2,T3> - Interface in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A void returning Function that supports Exception and 4 args

C

callBefore(TimeLimit, Callable<R>) - Method in interface com.github.timmy80.mia.core.ExecutionStage
Implementation of Async.callBefore(Executor, TimeLimit, Callable) which uses a local Executor and can implement context related checks.
callBefore(TimeLimit, Callable<R>) - Method in class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.InitialState
 
callBefore(TimeLimit, Callable<R>) - Method in class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Task
Implementation of Async.callBefore(Executor, TimeLimit, Callable) using the executor of this task.
callBefore(TimeLimit, Callable<R>) - Method in class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Terminal
Implementation of Async.callBefore(Executor, TimeLimit, Callable) with a check to ensure the Terminal is not terminated.

If at the execution time the teminal is terminated then the call will be completed exceptionally by an TerminatedTerminalException.
callBefore(TimeLimit, Callable<R>) - Method in class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.TerminalState
Implementation of Async.callBefore(Executor, TimeLimit, Callable) with a checks to ensure the State is active and the terminal not terminated.

If at the execution time the state is inactive then the call will be completed exceptionally by an InactiveStateException.
If at the execution time the teminal is terminated then the call will be completed exceptionally by an TerminatedTerminalException.

D

DefaultLivenessProbe - Class in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
The default liveness probe handler.
Simply check that no Task is hung for more than 20seconds.
Completes with status 200 OK if all the tasks are OK.
DefaultLivenessProbe(ProbesTask, Channel) - Constructor for class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.DefaultLivenessProbe
Constructor
DefaultReadinessProbe - Class in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
The default readiness probe handler.
Simply check that all Task are alive and not hung for more than 20seconds.
Completes with status 200 OK if all the tasks are OK and the ApplicationContext is not stop pending.
DefaultReadinessProbe(ProbesTask, Channel) - Constructor for class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.DefaultReadinessProbe
Constructor

eventStopRequested() - Method in class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Task
Event method called when the stop sequence of this task is triggered.
You can safely override this method to handle the event.
In order to prevent an immediate stop, you may add one or more epilogs to this Task by calling Task.registerEpilog(CompletableFuture)
eventStopRequested() - Method in class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Terminal
Event method called when the stop sequence of the parent Task is triggered.
You can safely override this method to handle the event.
In order to prevent an immediate stop, you may add one or more epilogs to this Task by calling Task.registerEpilog(CompletableFuture)

nextState(TerminalState) - Method in class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Terminal
Change the state of the Terminal.
On call to this method the previous state is immediately considered inactive and the next state active even though the methods State.eventLeaveState() and State.eventEntry() have not been called yet on the previous state and the next state respectively.

Terminal<T extends Task> - Class in com.github.timmy80.mia.core
A non Thread Executor which depends on a Task to be executed.
Creating terminals allows to dispatch the management of complex sub-tasks in a logical context.
Terminal provides a state mechanism which allows to further dispatch the complexity.

A Terminal has always a State unless terminated.
Terminal(T) - Constructor for class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Terminal
Constructor
TerminalState - Class in com.github.timmy80.mia.core

TerminalState() - Constructor for class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.TerminalState
Default constructor
terminate() - Method in class com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Terminal
End the life of this terminal.
A call on State.eventLeaveState() will be done on the active State and then Terminal.eventTermination() will be called.
